refnamediv.refpurpose: a widget displaying a graphical image or icon.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkPixmap widget displays a graphical image or icon. The icon is typically created using gdk_pixmap_colormap_create_from_xpm() or gdk_pixmap_colormap_create_from_xpm_d().

The pixels in a GtkPixmap cannot be manipulated by the application after creation, since under the X Window system the pixel data is stored on the X server and so is not available to the client application. If you want to create graphical images which can be manipulated by the application, look at GtkImage and GdkRGB.

refsect2.title: struct GtkPixmap

warning.para: GtkPixmap is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: The GtkPixmap-struct struct contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

refsect2.title: gtk_pixmap_new ()

warning.para: gtk_pixmap_new is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkPixmap, using the given GDK pixmap and mask.

listitem.simpara: a GDKBitmap which indicates which parts of the pixmap should be transparent.

refsect2.title: gtk_pixmap_set ()

warning.para: gtk_pixmap_set is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the GdkPixmap and GdkBitmap mask.

listitem.simpara: a GdkBitmap, which indicates which parts of the pixmap should be transparent. This can be NULL, in which case none of the pixmap is transparent.

refsect2.title: gtk_pixmap_get ()

warning.para: gtk_pixmap_get is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Gets the current GdkPixmap and GdkBitmap mask.

refsect2.title: gtk_pixmap_set_build_insensitive ()

warning.para: gtk_pixmap_set_build_insensitive is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets wether an extra pixmap should be automatically created and used when the pixmap is insensitive. The default value is TRUE.

listitem.simpara: set to TRUE if an extra pixmap should be automatically created to use when the pixmap is insensitive.
